intro: Thamnochortus piketbergensis, commonly known as the Piketberg dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and is known for its resilience in harsh environmental conditions. Thamnochortus piketbergensis is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
